I wasnâ€™t getting anywhere by emailing the hotel directly. Apparently â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€� was not in the managerâ€™s vocabulary. This place really has potential. The parking situation is bad. The driveway down onto Hotel Circle is steep and you can scrape your car. BUT, had this hotel lived up to the standards one would expect with the Doubletree name those things would have been minor details. The location in hotel circle is great. Easy access of course to the 8 & the 5, but not too bad to head up toward North County either, and really convenient to Old Town. Now they are just problems on a long list of things, most of which could be fixed by this joke of a hotel. Too bad there's a 10 photo limit!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING FIND IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: justadude1986
Reviews.Content: Awesome Doubletree! I booked this hotel with my United Airlines Mileage plus membership. Never been to San Diego before. This hotel was in such a great location! We rented a car not too far from this hotel and drove all over (between San Diego & Anaheim) It was so easy to get on the freeway from this hotel. It was in a nice location with a beautiful view of the mountains (freeway in your view which makes it even cooler to me). The staff was way too nice! The room was great! Beautiful, comfortable & clean. Didn't go in the pool but it looked very nice! I would defiantly stay here again. This hotel was a great value even if i did have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good....Not Great”
Reviews.Author: vincemvazquez
Reviews.Content: First, I am a Hilton Diamond VIP memeber. I stay at several Hilton properties throughout the year and this was my very first stay at this property. Now, ...I will start with the positives. Beautiful Hotel. Very nice rooms. Gorgeous Pool. The beds were very comfortable and I was even impressed with the Sofa which was excellent. The bar was nice and I personally thought the breakfast was outstanding. I was however not impressed with the customer service at check-in and check out. I feel the staff could of done a better job, especially for a doubletree. I always expect just a bit more. I would not say the person behind the desk was rude, but she did not seem like she wanted to be there. Also, I think they could benefit be having someone help guest with their bags. I will say that the parking situation is not good. It is not horrible but by no means great. It is also expensive. I did have a situation at check out where I was charged twice for parking, but the front desk took care of it immediately. All in all, I think the hotel could do a a few little things to be Great, but until they do, I would say I would think twice about staying there again with my family. If I was alone, I would probably go back again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer1451
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree in April 2010 in one of their family suites. The hotel room was very nice and we had so much fun in San Diego. We also visited their pool which was lovely as well and I think there was only 2 other people in it at the time. The best thing about the Doubletree is the cookies! I went up to front desk 3 times and asked for cookies and every time they gave me one with a smile on their face. So delicious. Now on to the bad. We live in Los Angeles so, San Diego is about a 2 hour drive without traffic. I called the night before and spoke with a nice man in reservations about the possibility of an early check in. He told me that they had 4 family suites available that evening so checking in early the next day should be no issue at all. He advised that I call the next morning but I failed to do that. The next day we left for San Diego and arrived at the hotel around 12:00 PM. When we went to check in they said that the room was unavailable and told housekeeping to put a "rush" on the room. It basically means that housekeeping skips the other rooms and goes to ours ASAP because we're there waiting. The guy at front desk told us it would be about an hour. Which, was totally fine! We went to the beach and came back 1 hour and 20 minutes later and the same guy said it would be ready in about 10 minutes. We were a little irritated but still ok. He told us to stay in the lobby and he would let us know as soon as it's ready. Thirty minutes later my Husband goes back up to the same man and says "how is our room looking"? and the man looks at me and my Husband as if he has no idea who we are. Please keep in mind that there are NO other guests checking in and this guy told us to wait in the lobby so that he could tell US when the room was ready. It was the strangest thing! Then when my Husband reminds him and he says "oh your room is ready" as if he knew all along. I have an 18 month old little boy that was running around the lobby out of boredom for 30 minutes for no reason at all! We were in his line of sight the whole time and he somehow forgot about us. My biggest advice if you stay at this hotel is don't plan on getting an early check-in. Actually, don't even plan on checking in on time because more than likely it won't happen. After that everything was fine. We only stayed one night though. I saw a lot of people complaining about the parking - which is now $16.00. The parking lot is on a steep hilll so when you leave go very slow. The hotel did ask me if I'd be parking there and I was warned about the charge in advance. I read someone said that there was ample parking on the street but I didn't really see that and it's a busy road on hotel circle so, you really don't want to park there. Another thing that I'm just remembering. All of the Family Suites on the 5th floor are next to elevators. There is no escaping it! I actually didn't mind it but you could hear it throughout the night. Also, I kept hearing the people next door to us and they kept waking us up. The walls seem to be pretty thin - not much they can do about that I guess though. I also wanted to add that I love how the Manager of this hotel responds to every review and raves about the positives but kind of dismisses the negatives. All in all I'd go there again but I wouldn't dare try and check-in early.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: shock43
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, wonderful pool area, great breakfast buffet, helpful service, and a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Problems but Responsive Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gary2hs
Reviews.Content: A friend and I arrived in San Diego on January 1st for a special event. The Doubletree Club Hotel was recommended. Check-in was smooth. The room was very nicely appointed, clean and roomy with a nice view. When the air-conditioner was turned on, there was a noticeable squeal - one that we knew would become a problem. We reported the problem to the front desk ... and it was corrected within 30 minutes! The in-room clock alarm went off at 4 am. (Probably something that should be included in the check-up of a room between guests). At 530 am, the fire alarm went off. Although there appeared to be speakers in the room, they were not used. After ringing for 5 minutes, the alarm went off. At 9 am, we discovered the cause of the fire alarm - the water boiler had blown a circuit ... so no hot water. When I called, the hotel apologized and siad they would remove the $14 charge for parking. We were told that the part would be replaced within 30 minutes, so we went to breakfast. On the way to breakfast, we noticed that pool was closed and yellow tape had appeared around it. The pool had been in use the night before. We were told that the pool was under repair and would be closed for a week. Oh? Nothing was said at check-in. The hotel gave us one night free. The buffet breakfast is $12.95 per person, but free for higher level Hilton HHonors members. Not a good deal at $12.95, but very good when it is free. All in all, the hotel is a middle of the road hotel. The problems were attended to in an expedient manner by a very responsive staff. That, is a noticeable rare quality in too many hotels. Great cookies!

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD HOWEVER WOULD NOT STAY HERE AGAIN, BIT OF A RIP OFF”
Reviews.Author: marshqld
Reviews.Content: Over the past 3 weeks I have travelled through California and other states from San Francisco, Carmel, Las Vegas and Anaheim. Unfortunatly this would be the hotel that I would not have fond memories of. First thing and if you have read other reviews is the Parking. If management takes these reviews seriously $14.00 per night for parking is a rip off. The parking facilities are difficult to negotiate and are not attached to the premises. Secondly with WiFi Internet at $9.90 per night is also a rip off when all the nearby hotels are advertising in big lights Free WiFi. Heres a tip if you stay on the left side of the hotel you can Pick up the WiFi signal from Kings Resort and use their facilities for free (in fact I am writing this review utilising their signal after they cut my service off 12 hours prior to our leaving). Now to the room....life in a shoe box. The accomodation that I had a Anaheim which was a simular configeration was about a quarter bigger and $20.00 per night cheaper. The bathrooms are tiny however they provide high quality complimentries. The Bed was excellent and very comfortable however, if you close the door between the two rooms this effects the circulation in the main bedroom. Of considerable notice was that upon our arrival in the room that it smelt like stale gym socks. The kids room was comfortable with no complaints from the sibs. Service from the staff was good especially from the shift manager in the restraunt my hats off to him. During our stay we heard every bump, bang and it did not help that our room was next to the ice maker and Coke Vending Machine thus we were kept up all night from disturbances. No assistance was provided to bring my bags in from the car. and had to wheel 7 pieces of luggage from the parking structure some 100m away. In summary Hilton Hotels in Australia are of the highest quality this unfortunalty is not the case with Club doubletree.. Whilst the Hotel more than suited our needs there was no "WOW" factor that is usually there with Hilton facilities. Of all the places that I have stayed at during the past three weeks I would unfortunatly have to say that I would not stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services Couldn't Be Bothered”
Reviews.Author: etal00
Reviews.Content: An event was being held at the hotel. The event had been announced on the KUSI news station. I was interested in going and called the hotel for more information. I was routed to Guest Services. The man with an accent said the event was happening today but he had no information and no idea how I could find out more. I could hear the disdain and exasperation in his voice that I even bothered to ask him and he just didn't want to be bothered with me. He didn't know, didn't want to know, and was not going to be bothered to find out how I could get more information. Even though I told him the event had been aired on KUSI news he didn't care. So I did the obvious - I called KUSI and they were able to give me the information I was looking for and they were happy to do so. This tells me that if I should need a hotel in San Diego that I won't book with this place. I was given the impression that they just don't want to be bothered with me. Perhaps they don't care to deal with women.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let previouse reviews scare you off. Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: I chose this property after staying at the dumpy Misson Valley Resort. I knew this had to be an upgrade no matter what the reviews said. I arrived slightly after 3PM and my room was available for check-in and my room was upgraded to a mini-suite on the 8th floor. The gals at the front desk were very courteous, used my name during the check-in process. The room was very nice with a seperate sitting room overlooking the pool area. The room was clean, well appointed with a comfortable couch and work station. Lighting was adequate and the internet connection was good. Each room has a fridge which is nice to store ice cold waters. The bed was extremely comfortable. The room was cooled nicely and controlled by a thermostat with out any undo noise. The main bathroom was small, but clean, vanity is outside in the room with a commode and shower in a seperate room. Plenty of hot water and pressure made for a nice shower. I did not visit their restaurant, although it appears they have recently chainged the name. The pool area was cool with the firepit. The only downside to this property is the parking lot. Parking is tight, and the ramps can be difficult to navigate if you have a large vehicle. Ramp parking is limited to vehicles less than 6 feet high. Spaces are smallish. It is a shame to charge $14 bucks for this lot, especially since they allow people who utilize the hotel for meeting space free access. I was honest and was charged the $14, but I could have gotten away without paying since the ramp gates were alway open. Seems like there would be a better way to handle that lot. Overall a great clean room and a very nice stay. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jvwatkin
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't understand what all of these negative reviewers are talking about. If you go to this hotel, or any hotel for that matter, expecting perfection, then you're probably going to find something wrong with the place. If you go looking for an updated, clean room, great pool/hot tub, and a friendly staff, that's what you'll get. For the people complaining about location and parking, do a little research before you book this hotel. I thought the location was great - near everything. I knew there was a charge for parking, so this wasn't a surprise. I knew there was a charge for internet, but I booked it anyway. I'm not the pickiest traveler in the world, but even if I was I wouldn't have had anything negative to say about this property. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tigger1106
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, I was worried about what I had gotten myself into. I had won this hotel on Priceline and was expecting the worst, but I was pleasantly surprised. I had called a few days in advance to request a 2 queen bed room and was told I was already assigned a room with 2 beds. Upon check-in, the clerk told me I had a 2 queen suite. My room was at the end of the hall on the 4th floor and had 2 queen beds and a smaller side room with a desk, bunk beds, and a tv. Since there were 4 of us, this worked out perfectly. We received the Doubletree chocolate chip cookies when we checked in and upon request several times during our stay. This location was ideal being close to the freeway and downtown. There was a pool with a hot tub and a fire pit. The staff was very helpful throughout our stay and there was free internet (but slow) and a printer in their business center. CONS (mostly parking): -Parking was $14 a day, although there was no mention of it upon check-in. We were charged on our checkout statement but was able to cut this down to only parking charge for 1 night. -The driveway is pretty steep and can scrape your car while entering or leaving. -The ramps in the parking garage are narrow and can be difficult when turning on and off the ramps. -The parking spaces are small. -This hotel is on a street full of hotels and can be missed if not paying attention.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: PDXSmileface
Reviews.Content: i was definitely nervous due to the mixed reviews, but in the end, i have to admit that i was pleasantly surprised with what we found. the location is a bit sketchy- rundown and old, but it was close to everything we needed to get to (seaworld, fashion square mall), no complaints there, very convenient. the room was clean. the separate bedroom with a bunkbed for the kids was a hit. we didn't have much interaction with the staff, but they were courteous. the only complaint was the breakfast- yuck. better off grabbing coffee and muffins at starbucks. overall experience was good. nothing spectacular, but it did the job. you can't really expect much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “With service like this it should a 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCabron
Reviews.Content: It was around 9 am when I called the hotel to see if we could check in before going out to the beach for the day. My wife had booked the room via priceline as a little getaway beach trip for my sons and I. Keep in mind that Iâ€™m a Hilton Honor silver tier member and we had never stayed at this doubletree before. We have always stayed at the Mission Valley property where we are treated like family. The young lady told us that there were no rooms available at the time. This was fine with me being that it was that early. At aprrox 10 am I called them from beach and asked them to check me in or to set aside a room with two beds so there wouldnâ€™t be a problem when we got there late in the afternoon. They said "No Problem" and told me that a room on the 7th floor overlooking the pool would be ready for me upon our arrival. We arrive at about 4 pm to wait in line for about 20 mins. due to the fact that the young lady was alone behind the counter. I noticed that she wasnâ€™t being the regular NICE type of person that are typically at Doubletree or any Hilton property. Well when we finally got to her I gave her my information when she tells me my room is still dirty and that it would be about an hour before it would be ready. After being at the beach all day I was ready to take anything. She said there would be a $14 for parking I made the comment that it should be free since my room wasnâ€™t ready, keep in mind never a smile, apology or anything of the sort. I asked for a manager and she responded that there wasnâ€™t one at the property till the next day. I asked who was in charge, she said ME! I can go on and on, but I think you get an idea of what Iâ€™m talking about here. There is a reason I stay at Hilton properties, this isnt it.NO way its not a 3 star, and I would never stay here again. Be careful if you choose a 3 star in the Mission Valley are of San Diego on priceline, you might get stuck here. Oh and by the way she didnt even give us the DOUBLETREE COOKIES!!!! Funny how one RUDE person can screw up the whole stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare...”
Reviews.Author: momeve
Reviews.Content: I have never felt the urge to leave a negative feedback for a hotel in many years of travel as I have with this hotel. I am sorry I am writing a long review (as I hate it when people do) but I strongly feel I have to tell the whole story, cause it is nothing less than shocking! So here it is: We decided to go to San Diego to take our daughter to Sea World. The double tree hotel was close to Sea World and they had junior suites which was exactly what we were looking for as we wanted to put our daughter down in the bedroom and be able to hang out and watch TV for a couple of hours in the other room. We paid for a junior suite though Expedia. I called the hotel the afternoon of our arrival and asked for them to put a crib in our room so that we can put our daughter down as soon as we got there. We were told over the phone that there is no need and that they can bring the crib up in 10 minutes when we get there. After a long day at Sea World with our 2 year old, we got to the hotel at 10 pm. There was no bell boy, no one to greet us at the hotel, and no one to even guide us in the right direction. My husband went in and was told he would have to park the car and just come in. We self parked and unpacked the car. Once we got in, we were told by the rude check in person, Jennifer Aparicio, that they did not have our room and that they over booked and we have to go to a different hotel! She said they will give us a refund and will not charge us at the other hotel. We asked her if we are going to get a comparable room at the other hotel and she said NO, you are JUST going to get a regular room! At this point I was started to get frustrated and upset at her level of condescension and non-sympathyâ€¦ after all, we were there with an extremely tired 2-year old. The least we expected after our PAID FOR room was given away, was an apologetic reception. We did not only get that, we got an overbearing, condescending and rude Jennifer. I said: what do you mean? where is the manager?" and she told us there is no manager and she is the ONLY person there. We insisted we get a room similar to the one we had booked and she told us "you are getting a free room out of this, what are you complaning about?" We were so shocked! not once did she say "I am so sorry for the inconviniance, I understand, I will try my best to accomodate you" But the story doesnâ€™t end there. She then started helping other customers, while we are standing there to the side. I had to leave to take our 2-year old to the bathroom, and I turned around to tell my husband to make sure that we are taken care of. Jennifer loudly demanded that I â€œCALM DOWNâ€�. At this point my husband lost his temper, but not his control. He proclaimed that he believed he may be in a twilight zone episode, and that he has never met anyone so rude, in all of his years of travel. And now the story gets even better. Jennifer, called for the security guard David Veja, and told him to escort us out of the hotel. This was becoming too much. I still can not believe my husband didnâ€™t resort to violence or profanity. The security guard then said â€œI have to escort you outâ€�, to which my husband's reply was â€œplease tryâ€�. Meanwhile, there are dozens of people at the hotel lobby watching this whole thing. And mind you, this is all happening in front of our 2 year old! The security guard then told us "you are getting a free room, stop whinig, this is my final offer, take it or leave it!!!!" to which my husband replied "who are you to give us an offer? you are a security guard here!" So we left and went to another hotel, exhausted and SHOCKED!!! I think, the worst Motel would have more qualified and professional people working there. This hotel shoud have 0 stars at best! It is now 10 days past our travel date and I just called Expedia to file a complaint just to find out they have not even called Expedia for the refund! Can you believe this?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel54915
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel. We were welcomed with warm chocolate chip cookies, which where also available any time just for the asking. Beds were comfortable, best yet that Ive seen in hotels. The location is good, not too far of a drive to local attractions. Nice quiet area. The pool temp was excellent nice and warm. The things I didnt like about the hotel were, there was no where within walking distance to go to, like stores or restraunts, the charge for parking was $14 a night which I didnt like. I dont think there should be a charge at all. Internet service was only available in lobby not in room so it was a pain to go down there anytime you wanted to check out things on internet which was alot, because this was the first hotel that didnt provide local telephone books in rooms. And I couldnt understand why they gave us 4 bath towels, 4 hand towels but only 3 wash cloths. We had to keep asking for a exta wash cloth. Overall it was a comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: swisstony123
Reviews.Content: This property is clearly trying to turn something of a corner, but they don't make it easy for themselves. Overly complicated rate structure meant I needed some help from management (it was something front desk couldn't or didn't want to help with) once we arrived, but even then the extras included in the rate I had booked were only provided after some chasing. Breakfast good and a reasonable price if you're on a non-inclusive rate. Design of family suite was a little lacking. A glass door separates the two rooms so light from the TV could keep little ones from going to sleep. Also, bunk beds had no real guard on the top level to stop kids rolling out, so not sure at what age i'd be happy having someone sleep up there. Note these family suites are located right opposite the ice vending machines so if you're a light sleeper, not to be recommended. Fair bit of noise also came through the interconnecting door. There's an awful lot of properties both in the immediate area and further afield. I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID at All Cost”
Reviews.Author: helix100
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have read the reviews before I stayed at this DoubleTree. The staff is incredibly rude and the room was not clean. We also had a major problem with noise throughout the night (11pm, 1 am, 3 am of screaming/drunken arguments/babies crying). I called the front desk and he basically stated that there was nothing he could do. This was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. Avoid this Doubletree at all cost-

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff - Beautiful Pool Area, Loved the Firepit”
Reviews.Author: 99Hawkeye
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in a kids suite on an overnight trip to San Diego. Our party included 2 adults, 1 teenager and 2 children under 10. I checked the prices on various places offering suites and felt we got a great value for what we paid. I booked the hotel through Expedia. We all enjoyed swimming in the pool which was heated to a nice 86 degrees. The firepit was also a nice feature. Check-in was quick and efficient. The front desk staff were great and very friendly. They had maps and advice on how to get to various places. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average, adequate for the price”
Reviews.Author: ekswl
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 2 nights at this hotel to attend a conference in the area. The check-in was a bit slow, because the front desk was unmanned for about 5 minutes. Once the staff showed up, check-in was fairly quick. When I got to my room, I saw that they gave me a double room, although I had booked a King room. I called guest services and was told that the King rooms were all booked even though I booked and paid for a King room a month in advance. I went to the bathroom, and when I lifted the toilet cover, I was completely grossed out because it looked dirty! I thought it was someone's poop, eww!! But it didn't go away after flushing a dozen times, so maybe it wasn't poop. Still, it looked dirty so I was skeptical about the cleanliness of the whole room. Also they need to use more bleach washing their towels or inspect them better because 2 out of 3 bath towels had some yellow stains. Well, other than that... the room was adequate for the price I paid and the purpose I was there for - business. The room is quite big and well-maintained for a hotel of its class. And despite the fact that the hotel is right next to the freeway, it was quiet at night. I liked the modern decor of the room and the lobby, too. I didn't try the restaurant or the pool so no comments about facilities. However if I visit the area again, I would look into other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Kids suite the best”
Reviews.Author: EyeMD
Reviews.Content: This was a clean, semi-hip hotel on hotel circle. Not in a pretty area (surrounded by hundreds of other hotels, almost all with free breakfasts), but worked for me and the family, Kids suite well worth it. 2 bedrooms separated by a door, each room had its own TV, and the kids had bunk beds. Felt like a dope paying for parking and breakfast, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Unhelpful staff, Watch out for extra charges”
Reviews.Author: setndrift
Reviews.Content: The condition of the room and the hotel in general was pretty good. The rooms are recently updated and have 32" flat screen tvs, and fairly nice bathroom vanities (the shower/tubs are not updated). The beds were fairly comfortable, but could have been better. All rooms seem to come with balconies. The hotel website says they have laundry facilities, this is not true, they were removed in late October. The staff was fairly friendly although not very helpful. My stay was for 7 nights and I had booked a room a few months prior. The night I checked in I found the same room through the hotel's website was being offered for $40/night less, the staff refused to do anything. Their suggestion was that I should have checked the price prior to checkin and rebooked the hotel with the new rate. TIPS: Parking here is $12 a night, but you are not required to pay. There is ample street parking in the area around the hotel, which is free. Internet access is $10 a day. It is free if you request access in the lobby though, even through your own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but extra charges were a bit much”
Reviews.Author: Mainer2008
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from SD and had a nice stay at the Doubletree. The staff was friendly and eager to please and the room was nice. However they charged for parking (but did not tell us beforehand), and they charged for internet access which seemed absurd. The location while central to getting on the highway is on this sad strip of hotels. Luckily it is fairly close to some family friendly restaurants but you always have to get into your car. The room was clean but there was hair in the sink when we arrived and popcorn encrusted in one of the towels. They had Neutrogena products which was great but the worst room coffee ever. The beds were super soft but overall okay. The pool and hot tub were okay but not great. This is not a hotel to stay in if you want to go walking or for a jog. It is a place to just sleep while heading to other places. I was glad that we only stayed for three nights and not our whole vacation. Overall, recommended for families and business travelers who are not hanging out in the hotel but headed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Trv71
Reviews.Content: Our room had nonworking TV and filthy bathroom floors. Our car licensed plate was stolen from their covered parking garage. Front office didnâ€™t know what to do & didnâ€™t have San Diego Police Department phone number! Manager was disrespectful, rude, and argumentative. He offered no apology or further assistance. It is disappointing to have something like this happen, but more disappointing to have others disregard it as no big deal. This is what this hotel and their guest assistance service did! They lack professionalism & customer service. I will NOT stay at this or other Doubletree Clubs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price but...”
Reviews.Author: MultiplesMom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Doubletree Club Hotel in San Diego. It was in a great location to get to all of the most popular nearby tourist sites such as SeaWorld and San Diego Zoo. The hotel has recently been remodeled so things looked pretty new. However, the parking was tight and limited for oversized vehicles. We literally parked behind their parking garage and had to walk down a steep hill with our little kids to get to the hotel. Also the pool looked as though it had just been repainted and was cloudy! My son accidently spilled Gatorade on the carpet in one of our rooms. We called them immediately. They sent the head of housekeeping and she looked it over. Later she sent in a housekeeper to try to clean it. The stain wouldn't come out. We tried cleaning it ourselves but didn't have enough time to get the stain totally out. We checked out but didn't receive a bill for the stain until after we arrived back home. If they had used ScotchGard on their cheap carpet I am sure the stain would have come right out.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice! But under construction.”
Reviews.Author: AZfirewife
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very modern decor, clean, friendly staff, nice pool. Cons: Under construction. They should of mentioned that on their site and when contacted. No free internet service ($10 a day fee your lap or their wireless keyboard in room) First off let me state that we have stayed in LOTS of the hotels in hotel circle area in the past 13 years. So I have a good pool to compare from. We booked ours through Get Away Today Vacations. (highly recommend it too) I was a bit worried reading the reviews. But to our wonderful surprise our room was brand new! Check in was seamless thanks to GATV. At the front desk they told us that there was a $7 a day parking charge...which I expected $14 from reading the reviews. However I reminded them that I booked with GATV and the lady gave us a free parking pass. Upon entering the lobby was above average for Hotel Circle. Nice, clean and modern. We were assigned a room on the third floor. (This is an 8 story building and from what I understand only levels 8 and 3 were open. The rest were still under construction.) We didnt notice the construction too much. Our room was pretty quite 99% of the time. However we didn't sleep in past 8am and we were gone most of the time between 10am till around 4pm. One guest that we talked to said her room was a very noisy during the day when she tried to put her daughter down for a nap. She too wish that they would of disclosed the construction when booking. Room was clean, we had a suite that slept 2 adults and 4 kids 13 yrs and under. The beds and pillows and linens were THE BEST! EXTREMELY Comfortable and clean. The carpet was new which is always a plus in any hotel. Missing the mini fridge they use to have. Flat screen tv, wireless keyboard for internet access if you don't have a laptop. Video game controllers. Bathroom needed better lights. Hard to really tell how your makeup looks. Better venation for moisture would be recommended too, but don't know many hotels that don't have that problem. Water pressure was a bit weak but the shower heads were great enough to compensate. All the "bath samples" items were Neutrogena not some no-name brand. Came with a full size blow dryer and LOTS of towels! The pool and jacuzzi was clean and comfortably heated with a plentiful supply of pool towels. Housekeeping was very good. They were very very quiet when in the halls unlike some places Ive been to. Check out was seamless again. Just turned in keys and that was it. Do becareful when entering and exiting their STEEP drive way. We saw a Corvette bottom out just creeping down. Go in and out on an angle is recommended. Also their garage parking structure is very low and has thin isle and parking spaces. We have a Honda Odyssey and with a medium size luggage carrier on top we just barely cleared the overhead pipes by 2 inches if that to spare.

Reviews.Title: “No Thanks !”
Reviews.Author: californiadreamers_8
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment. We looked forward to staying at the property from the pictures. the lobby and public areas were very nice. However Our room smelled strongly of previous sweaty occupants and the bathroom was long overdue for an update. Mildew all around the tiles etc gave us the heebie jeebies. We tried one night and were woken with the sounds of 2 adjoining rooms being renovated. Promptly asked to be moved. New room was better but Hilton won't get our business in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the value”
Reviews.Author: vacation_junkie03
Reviews.Content: We did a 2-night stay over the Easter weekend with 2 adults and 2 kids ( 5 yr old and 8 months). The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us. The double sofabed was an added bonus so our older child got her own bed. The warm fresh chocolate chips cookies brought big smiles to everyone. We enjoyed the comfortable beds and lots of fluffy pillows. There was enough room to park the stroller inside the room. When we arrived in the room, we immediately checked for A/C and hot water before unpacking. The bathroom was locked and so we called the maintenance/housekeeping. Within a couple of minutes, they came to unlock the door, and maintenance guy checked the A/C and changed the filter to optimize airflow. The A/C unit was very quiet and so you could occasionally hear the freeway traffic. There's also a small balcony which was nice to enjoy some fresh air. We went to the pool mid-morning and fortunately, we brought the room towels as there were no pool towels when we got there. The towels were brought in around 12 noon. The jacuzzi was extremely hot and so we didn't sit in it. There's also a fire pit to enjoy. Overall, our we enjoyed our stay and we'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, but...”
Reviews.Author: hondo79
Reviews.Content: Beautiful public spaces, convient location, insulting check in, horrible room. I booked a suite based on a wonderful stay at another location. Upon entering our initial suite, the carpet & furniture appeared to have extensive water damage. The curtains between the rooms were held on the rod with hot pink zip ties & curtain rings. Our request to move to another room was granted, however the room was only slightly better. The upholstered furniture was worn and dirty. During evening showers the water pressure & temperature fluctuated. I was awakened by unidentified random noises. Refrigerator & micorwave were of great use. After viewing a recent news story, I decided to wipe the drinking glasses provided. Unfortunately on more than one occasion the white towels used were soiled. There was a VCR only, coupled with an inability to connect portable DVD player. Please check out the photos. Again...beautiful public spaces, convient location, but horrible rooms.

Reviews.Title: “MichCali”
Reviews.Author: Mich8217
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worse Doubletrees i've ever been to. WARNING: do not book a net direct rate thru this hotel!!! I booked a net direct rate believing that paying upfront would be cheaper, the next day, doubletree dropped their net direct rate by $30 a night!! I called doubletree & the net direct and no one was willing to give me a price adjustment. They said that the price you pay is locked down, no matter if you're paying $30 more a night. I spoke with the manager and she was only willing to comp my parking ($14) a night but was not willing to do anything else. I was placed in a suite ( nothing more than a normal sized room with a wall seperating the beds & fold out couch). Bathrooms were outdated and there was no water pressure. Of the 3 nights we were there, the maid only gave us new towels for the first night. The morning we leave, i noticed that the hotel charged us another tax on our net direct rate which means that they won't price adjust my rate lower but can charge me more taxes... I spoke with the front desk and Calvin the receptionist was VERY RUDE... He made it seem like i'm inconviencing him and that he was working on something else so my adjustment will be processed in 20-30 minutes. There are a ton of hotels in that area, stay clear of the Doubletree Club!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and nice stay”
Reviews.Author: marerod
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one Saturday night during a weekend visit to SD. The hotel was really nice and the price was great $100 for a suite. The suite set up was odd but it served its purpose since the lviing room was private with an extra sofa bed. The beds were comfy as was the bedding. The bathroom needed remodeling though. The grounds looked very pretty and well kept as did the lobby. The lobby had free wireless access and the pool looked modern. The free warm cookies was a great touch! This hotel is centrally located so that was a plus. The downside was the $14 parking fee but we risked it and parked without paying and nothing happened. We might have gotten lucky. All in all i'd stay here again if the price was right. :) good experience, nice front desk, nice grounds, comfortable sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: jaelsne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not up to the Doubletree standard. It's an older hotel that needs updating and maintenance, as well as a better-trained staff. We arrived on a Thursday night. Though we had guaranteed our room via a credit card, check-in was lengthy as the desk clerk searched for an available room. I told her that my top priority is a quiet location within the hotel, and double-checked that my room was in a quiet spot. Our room was a "junior suite." I don't recommend this type of room at all. It was the same size as a regular room, with a horizontal wall cutting the room in half. One side contained two beds, the other a hide-a-bed and second television. The "bedroom" side was dimly lit--and we later found out that there was no heat/air vent in the room. In the middle of the night, we found we were very warm. Only then we realized that there was a fan for circulation built into the dividing wall--but the button that operated it was broken. Additionally, the phone jack was inoperable--the phone jack was unplugged. We fixed that one quickly. Then the remote to the TV was inoperable. Maintenance was summoned, and they arrived quickly with batteries. No big deal. But the worst was yet to be discovered. When we went to bed, we kept hearing a loud noise. At first I thought that people were wheeling luggage up and down the hall. Later, I realized that our room was positioned directly behind the elevator shaft. In fact, we shared a wall with the elevator--and heard it grinding up and down through the night. So much for a quiet location! I only wonder how the circulation fan would have added to the din (if we had been able to run it!). Another minus--this grade of hotel did not warrant a $14.00/night parking fee in an aging, detached garage. On the plus side--the beds were cozy and the room was clean. The hot breakfast was decent, but expensive. On the whole, this hotel screamed CHEAP. The decor was weathered, I've had more extensive and less expensive breakfasts at other hotels, and the service was less than than warm and efficient. You can do better than this in San Diego, even for a budget price.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: akhippychick
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was a suite and we were traveling with five kids. The front desk clerks were friendly but I wasn't too happy about having to pay $14 a night for parking. The room was just o.k. The fold out sofa bed needed to be replaced since there were holes in the upholstery but the beds in the adjoining room were very comfortable. The best thing about this place was the laundry facility. They had the best dryers I've ever used and were inexpensive. I just felt that this was not a good hotel for traveling with kids. You can get more bang for your buck elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Oasis”
Reviews.Author: tammlynn
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, quiet hotel. The highlights were the comfortable bed, the great view of the harbor, and the pool/hot tub area on the fifth floor! The staff were friendly and helpful. The only negatives were the bathtub where paint was peeling in multiple areas and the times available for the airport shuttle. We had a 7 am flight, and the hotel shuttle does not start running until 6 am for regular guests. However, the shuttle begins at 5 am for air crew. Luckily the air crew from United Airlines were kind enough to allow my husband and I to get on their shuttle with them since there was plenty of room. I think the hotel should allow guests to ride the shuttles if space is available, after giving priority to the air crew staff! I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Hamachi
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during a business trip to San Diego. The hotel's website made the place look better than it actually was. First, the bathroom in my room was dirty (such as the floors and bathtub). In addition, a couple of the lightbulbs in my room were dead. Like most hotels that I've stayed at, this place has a business center with computers for guests to use. However, unlike most hotels, this place charges guests to use the computers (such as to surf the internet). You should also know that this hotel does not offer a complimentary continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Plain vanilla hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mardigan
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing special, particularly for the price. Just a garden-variety chain hotel, nothing especially terrible or outstanding. The restaurant was very pricey, for average food and below average service. Pros: Balconies, feather pillows, warm and soft blankets. The bathroom was stocked with tea and coffee (both caf and decaf). They will provide some very nice additional toiletries on request. Cons: Half the electricity in the room wasn't working properly. Our room was sandwiched in between the fountain out front and the restaurant, making it, well, not the quietest room I've ever had. We had 4 people sharing 8 hangers in the closet. More were requested and promised, but never came. I did like the big white loofas in the bathroom - oh, no wait - those were towels!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our vacation”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel06
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our two kids(ages 5 and 12) stayed at the Doubletree Club for our Southern California vacation. The hotel met our needs perfectly! The front desk staff was very helpful, answering any question we had. The room was clean and the beds were very comfortable. The sleeper sofa was great for my 5 year old. He just loved "sleeping on the couch." The hotel's location at Hotel Circle right at a freeway made traveling around very easy. Old Town was just a short drive down the street and if we wanted to use the Trolley system, the stop was close by at the Fashion Valley Mall. One night we returned to the hotel after a long day at Disneyland to find the parking garage closed due to a car fire(Someone had pulled into the garage and then their car burst into flames). The garage need to cleaned up and then inspected for structural damage before anyone could use it. The hotel staff made arrangements for us to park in the lot at the hotel right next door which we did with no problem. The garage was quickly deemed safe and were once again able to park there. I would stay at this hotel the next time we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for business travel”
Reviews.Author: KGQ
Reviews.Content: Being a loyal HHonors member, I booked this hotel for 2 nights for a combined business trip/college tour trip with my 17 year old son. It was the right price with a seeminly good location. All I can say is YUCK. We had a beautiful view of the freeway off our tiny balcony, and the bathroom was smaller than our powder room at home. The place is absolutely packed with little kids....needless to say we didn't use the pool. Next to impossible to get a seat at breakfast. I called the Hilton at Mission Bay the next morning and they kindly helped me bail out of this place and gave us an absolutely beautiful room overlooking the bay. A little more expensive, but completely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Handled both biz travelers & families with ease”
Reviews.Author: porscheduo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week in July. Spacious rooms, comfy beds and great views from high floor rooms. AC worked well. Great location off Hotel Circle and its easy to get on the freeway though there is no freeway noise. Speaking of noise, hotel was full of families and I was sure that there would be screaming kids eveywhere but other than in the lobby, I never heard noise from other guests. Property seems well-managed and there are nice touches like ice water in the lobby for all guests. I appreciated the onsite laundry machines. Staff was professional and helpful even though constantly busy. I wish they would put mouthwash in the room, but none of the Doubletree properties I have stayed in ever do that. You have to pay for parking ($14/day) but at least its covered parking so you don't have to get into a car that has been baking in the hot San Diego sun. This hotel really exceeded my expectations and was very reasonably priced for how nice the property is. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good stay”
Reviews.Author: mk407
Reviews.Content: Good location (off Hotel Circle which is in the middle of San Diego), area wasn't shady at all. Bathroom was clean and spacious. Room was clean. Beds seemed new & were very comfy with more than enough pillows available. Stayed for a night or two with friends; enough room for 5 people (2 doubles & 1 sofabed) to sleep. Had to ask for the free cookies but there was no limit. Parking garage was decent and had a security arm at the entrance. Did not stay in the room very long, but service seemed average. Lobby looks nice, amenities look nice (such as the pool), but didn't use any during the stay. Just wish they offered free continental breakfast and parking. If you are using a promotional offer, be sure to remind them because I had one which I used during the reservation process, but forgot about it during my stay & did not follow up on it afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, location OK”
Reviews.Author: FloJo-UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights during our vaction. Chose this hotel specifically for its proximity to Seaworld and the Zoo. I don't have any complaints about the hotel. We had a nice clean room which was spacious and well appointed, staff were helpful and location is convenient for attractions. note though that you will need a car to go out at night as there is nothing within walking distance of the hotel. $12 per night charged for parking. There is a pool but it was under renovation during our visit so can't comment on it. Nice hotel - i would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or Pleasure!!!!”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler35
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with a great location. I was in town for business and am a loyal Hilton Honors member. I was able to get my points and the room rate was u8nder $200. The room was very spacious, clean and I had a balcony. The bathrooms seemed to be recently renovated with new granite counters. When I come back to San Diego with my family I will be staying here. The room was spacious with the bedroom seperated from the living room. My kids will love to have their own space. I had breakfast daily in the hotel and thought the food was great and a good value. The front desk staff was very friendly and the housekeepers did a great job. The location for sales calls was great and dinner options in downtown San Diego was only 5 minutes away. There was a large mall across the street and I did not have time to go, but I know my wife will be there when we come back this summer for a family vacation. I highly recommend the Doubltree Club San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “NASTY!”
Reviews.Author: LisaV-06
Reviews.Content: Stay somewhere else! This is a nasty, disgusting run-down property. We reserved a non-smoking 1 bedroom suite for $200/night. The disgusting "suite" was tiny, reeked of old cigarettes & the carpet was stained & filthy. My powder room is bigger then their bathroom. They have 3 elevators....but none of them work properly. The parking garage is a disaster & it's not connected to the hotel. Very disappointed with the Hilton chain.

Reviews.Title: “you won't believe this”
Reviews.Author: keil38
Reviews.Content: Price was great per night. Room was clean, spacious and quiet. Not crazy about having to pay $12 a day to park my car, but hey, this is southern CA, you know? Now to what I am STILL burning about: The airlines lost my luggage, so when we checked in at this hotel, we told the front desk to call on our cell, and/or leave a message on our room's voicemail as soon as the luggage arrived. That was on Wednesday, Feb. 21. On Friday I called the airline to get a progress report and they told me they'd delivered my bag TWO HOURS after we checked in at the hotel. Did the hotel call? No. Did they try again on Thursday to reach me? No. Did they try on Friday? No. Would I have flown back to the east coast on Sunday thinking my bag was permanently lost? Yes. Is this without a doubt the sorriest excuse for customer service I have ever experienced at a hotel any where in the world? Yes. Meanwhile, I went out and spent over $200 trying to replace underwear, toiletries, the minimum of clothing, etc. - all the while my luggage was downstairs behind the front desk!! Will I EVER stay here again? Not on your life.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION! Good value”
Reviews.Author: VegasRPH
Reviews.Content: Ok. My wife and I just returned from a 2 night/3 day stay at The Doubletree Club San Diego over October 1-3. The hotel is not fancy, but is clean and welcoming once inside. Yes, the $10.00/day for parking is odd and the garage is SMALL and NARROW, but parking anywhere in San Diego is a premium. Hotel Circle in general is in a fantastic location to almost every attraction. The Doubletree is 1.5 miles to Sea World, 3.5 miles to the ZOO, 5 miles to Ruth's Chris on Harbor Drive, 2 miles to Fashion Valley Mall (great outdoor mall) and the beaches are very close as well (maybe 2-3 miles). Our room was a JR Suite/King/Balcony which was nice. It had a King bed with very soft pillows and a seperate living room with the balcony. 2 TV sets and a wet bar with microwave & fridge. It is a little noisy due to the freeway nearby, but didn't bother us to change our minds about the great location of the hotel. Pool is heated and very clean, Spa is HOT and clean also. Overall, a B+ or 8/10 rating in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: 808traveler
Reviews.Content: Being that Hotel Circle contains a wide array of hotels, I think it may be just personal preference as to where you stay. On a previous trip, I stayed at the Holiday Inn (Hotel Circle) but this time decided to try something else, I was not disapointed. The hotel welcomed us with a lounge area in the lobby (big screen tv included) and because we had arrived so early in the morning, they were more than happy to hold our bags while we went galavanting. Upon check in, the staff was very helpful and welcomed us with two warm chocolate cookies (VERY good). Our room was very spacious and clean although there wasn't much of a view. The parking area can be a bit of a walk and the ramps leading up and down the parking levels are VERY narrow. If you drive a big SUV or truck, you may want to park elsewhere. The location is awesome, few minutes away from Sea World and Qualcomm, and a couple of minutes away from Fashion Valley Mall (a very nice place to shop). Getting to and from the hotel is very convenient as it is located right next to the freeway. Sports Arena Blvd., which contains tons of eating places, is also just a hop and a skip away. There is internet access ($5 for about 1/2 hour) in the lobby and a nice swimming pool / jacuzzi which is open until 11 pm. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Skip the aggravation, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: BobandKim
Reviews.Content: My wife and I made reservations (and paid for our room) over a month in advance at the Doubletree Club Hotel San Diego. Upon arrival we were told that they had over booked for our room preference of a king bed, so we would be forced to take a room with two queen beds instead. We parked our vehicle in the $10 per day run-down, tiny-ramped parking garage and headed to our room. When we opened the door, someone else's luggage, camera bag, and clothes were laid out on the bed...we had walked into an occupied room! We immediately closed the door, went to the front desk and explained what had happened. No apologies, no explanation, just a rude, matter-of-fact "Here are keys to another room." I tried explaining to the people working at the front desk that they could have put us in a difficult position had someone been in their room when we walked in, but they didn't want to hear it; they rudely dismissed my concerns. When we arrived in the second room we soon discovered that the air conditioning didn't work....they didn't have another room for us so we had to sleep in a hot room. The following morning we wanted to check out and find something else; they wanted to charge us a $50.00 early departure fee. Through the help of our travel company we were able to get that waived, but under the circumstances, I wouldn't have expected to battle over something like that. I have never experienced worse customer service, do yourself a favor...stay somewhere else!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not a busines hotel”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaTraveler2
Reviews.Content: There's nothing terribly wrong with the Doubletree Club Hotel San Diego. But nothing really great, either. For $199 (rack rate $499), it's not a good value. The parking garage is aged, with narrow turns and safety railings that look like they were designed to meet bare minimum standards. Stairwells connecting parking to hotel are dark. Parking is $10/day with no clear reason why a non-hotel guest would park there. Internet is $10/day, and wired only (in the rooms; there is wireless in the lobby). Rooms were spacious, clean, and comfortable. Families with kids enjoyed the pool, and a high school sports team was having a meeting in the lobby. Laundry was stacked up outside the lower level's elevator, which you exit in order to access the game room and fitness room. The trolley stop is indeed 10 minutes away, but only via car. Walking is not an option (no sidewalks). I did not get the standard Doubletree chocolate chip cookie. Didn't see anyone else with one, either. The hotel is located in an area of mid-range, older, unattractive but probably perfectly functional hotels. There's nothing overly wrong with this hotel, but it's not a good value for the money. It's not what I would expect from a Doubletree. There was a very large conference in San Diego at the time of my travel, so it raised prices.

Reviews.Title: “Less Than Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: juicyfruit909
Reviews.Content: The location was good for accessibility to the highway and other local attractions,however,being so close to the highway it caused noise and inability to walk anywhere (ie:restaurants or attractions). The pool was nice, clean and well maintained. The beds were extremely comfortable. The property itself needs repair and updating (electrical outlets in our room were broken, crack in bathroom mirror, broken lock on slider to balcony, bathroom sink clogged due to broken plug.) The sofa bed was unsleepable as it too was broken and even if it weren't it was terribly uncomfortable. The staff did their best to accomadate us, switching us to another room (this too with slight livable problems). We did not feel the price was justified for the overall quality with so many other "fair" hotels in the area for the same or less money. We were disappointed, expecting more from a Doubletree Property.

Reviews.Title: “Not your best bet...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stay in San Diego about 4 weeks a year. For this visit, I was only there one night, so I thought I would save the company money and stay at the Doubletree Club. I am a Hilton Honors member and was "upgraded" to a little bigger room. Well, one of the televisions did not work, I could not connect to the wireless internet, and the cord for the internet was not long enough to reach any surface other than the couch. The curtains were torn and the room looked a little tired. They also have a lot of restaurants slipping things under the door, something that does not happen at the other Hilton properties in San Diego. The bed was clean and comfortable and the parking was free. It is not my first choice of places to stay in San Diego. I mentioned my thoughts to the hotel and all I got was "sorry."

Reviews.Title: “Pritty good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for three nights in a suite. With two teenagers it was great to have a sofabed that was wider than the standard sofabeds in other hotels. Only downside traveling with family was that breakfast was not included. One recommendation to prospective guests, ask for rooms as far from the street as possible. We were at the street side and could hear the traffic and air conditioners quite loudly at times. Clean rooms, friendly staff, great cookies.....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK, but location not so”
Reviews.Author: Seajack
Reviews.Content: Staff were nice; room and breakfast were average. Overall the $129 I paid seems a bit steep in restrospect, but there were a fair number of business travelers. Location was disappointing as getting into town was $20 taxi fare (no mass transit nearby).

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: marthah5114
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 6 nights and found the hotel and service to be excellant. The only downfall was that only 1 elevator was working. Otherwise all else was fine. It is very convenient to main roads and restaurants. I would stay here again if I came to San Diego again!

Reviews.Title: “Generally positive, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: dweingart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Doubletree Club for two nights in early January. We used Hilton HHonors points for the stay. The hotel was conveniently located to freeways and the major San Diego attractions, though there really isn't anything notable within walking distance except for other hotels. (Hence the name, Hotel Circle...) Our room was clean and reasonably spacious. The cookies at check-in are always first-rate. The fitness center was reasonably nice. The pool area also seemed pleasant, though we did not take advantage of it since the weather was a little bit cool. The hotel also offers its guests free internet access in its Business Center (1 PC), which is a plus for those of us who don't travel with a laptop. The TV area in the lobby also seemed inviting. There is no charge to park in the adjacent garage, which is better than some other hotels in San Diego. We did not try the restaurant. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay with no complaints, though it is hard to identify anything particularly outstanding or unique about the hotel (other than the cookies).

Reviews.Title: “Clean property, fair price, close to attractions”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for ... We booked this hotel on line, and got the room for $119. The room itself was adequate ... but smelled horrendous ... like a combination of musty old room and B.O. Other than that, the only matter we took issue with was the buffet breakfast. "Continental" breakfast has a loose translation, depending on the place. We were given certificates for the continental breakfast, then told, after we had started dining, that did not include the hot items (hash browns, sausage, eggs) on the buffet. While the two dollars extra per person was fair, it is somewhat misleading; I resented it. Staff was pleasant, room was clean, location convenient - if not quiet.

Reviews.Title: “it met our needs”
Reviews.Author: jon160
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Club on Hotel Circle in San Diego for 4 nights over Thanksgiving weekend. It certainly met our needs. Clean, quiet, and felt safe. We had 2 large rooms, each with 2 queen sized beds and a pull-out sofa. OK, the hotel isn't the newest on the street...in fact, it's probably 40 years old, but the staff was pleasant, and the location was great. We booked it as part of a flight/hotel combo, and that's how we got such a good price on the package. If the price is as good next time, we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, friendly, business orientated”
Reviews.Author: Bobbin2
Reviews.Content: Firstly I must say that the staff were very friendly. There was an unexplained charge to our room which was refunded without question. The room was clean apart from the balcony which had mouldy crusts of bread on it! The electrics were slightly worrying, loose sockets etc and the extractor fan didnt work in the bathroom which we mentioned on the first day (nothing was done!) Don't expect UK appliances to work with the same effectiveness (I guess just weaker electricity supply in US?) The pool was nice with free towels and well positioned loungers. The hotel is in close proximity to the highways, its a good job we had a car as there is not much within walking distance. If we went to San Diego again we would stay further into town in the Mission Bay area. This hotel seemed primarily geared up for business persons and I must say we did feel a little out of place.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel San Diego - Hotel Circle
HotelInfo.Address: 1515 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
